text: The is the only national library in Japan. It was established in 1948.Pincus, Leslie. (2006). "Revolution in the Archives of Memory: The Founding of the National Diet Library in Occupied Japan" in Francis X. Blouin and William G. Rosenberg, eds. Archives, Documentation, and Institutions of Social Memory: Essays from the Sawyer Seminar, p. 382. The purpose of the library is to assist members of the . The library is similar in purpose and scope to the U.S. Library of Congress. The National Diet Library has two main facilities. One is in Tokyo and the other is in Kyoto.
